title: Text Figures
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Text Figures**

Also called lowercase figures, or oldstyle figures, these number forms are designed to be used in running text. Text figures feature numerals that come to the [x-height](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/x-height): 0,1,2; figures with [descenders](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/descender): 3,4,5,7,9; and [ascending](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ascender) figures: 6, 8. Some varations of text figures may not fit this same scheme, but this is the norm.

See also [Lining Figures](http://web.archive.org/web/20140501053103/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Lining%20Figures).
